text: 1. When the Kurus had been destroyed by (hail) stones 1 , Ushasti K âkrâya n a lived as a beggar with his virgin 2 wife at Ibhyagrâma.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 2. Seeing a chief eating beans, he begged of him. The chief said: 'I have no more, except those which are put away for me here.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 3. Ushasti said: 'Give me to eat of them.' He gave him the beans, and said: 'There is something to drink also! Then said Ushasti: 'If I drank of it, I should have drunk what was left by another, and is therefore unclean.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 4. The chief said: 'Were not those beans also left over and therefore unclean?'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 'No,' he replied; 'for I should not have lived, if I had not eaten them, but the drinking of water would be mere pleasure 3 .'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 5. Having eaten himself, Ushasti gave the remaining beans to his wife. But she, having eaten before, took them and put them away.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 6. Rising the next morning, Ushasti said to her: 'Alas, if we could only get some food, we might gain a little wealth. The king here is going to offer a sacrifice, he should choose me for all the priestly offices.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 7. His wife said to him: 'Look, here are those beans of yours.' Having eaten them, he went to the sacrifice which was being performed.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 8. He went and sat down on the orchestra near the Udgât ri s, who were going to sing their hymns of praise. And he said to the Prastot ri (the leader):

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 9. 'Prastot ri , if you, without knowing 1 the deity which belongs to the prastâva (the hymns &c. of the Prastot ri ), are going to sing it, your head will fall off.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 10. In the same manner he addressed the Udgât ri : 'Udgât ri , if you, without knowing the deity which belongs to the udgîtha (the hymns of the Udgât ri ), are going to sing it, your head will fall off.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 11. In the same manner he addressed the Pratihart ri : 'Pratihart ri , if you, without knowing the deity which belongs to the pratihâra (the hymns of the Pratihart ri ), are going to sing it, your head will fall off.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: They stopped, and sat down in silence.

translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 18:1 When they had been killed either by stone weapons, or by a shower of stones, which produced a famine in the land. Comm.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 18:2 Â t ikî is not the name of the wife of Ushasti, nor does it mean strong enough to travel. S aṅkara explains it as anupa g âtapayodhâridistrîvyañ g anâ, and Ânandagiri adds, Svairasa m kâre 'pi na vyabhikâra s aṅketi dar s ayitum â t ikyeti vi s esha n am. She was so young that she was allowed to run about freely, without exciting any suspicion. Another commentator says, G ri hâd bahirgantumarhâ anupa g âtapayodharâ.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 18:3 Or, according to the commentator, 'water I can get whenever I like.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 19:1 The commentator is at great pains to show that a priest may officiate without knowing the secret meanings here assigned to certain parts of the sacrifice, and without running any risk of punishment. Only, if another priest is present, who is initiated, then the uninitiated, taking his place, is in danger of losing his head.
